required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ASP8825 - Pharmacokinetics Study in Patients With Impaired Renal Function and Haemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Study of ASP8825 - Evaluation of Pharmacokinetics in Patients With Impaired Renal Function and Haemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the pharmacokinetics and safety of ASP8825 in patients with impaired renal function and haemodialysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameter of gabapentin in plasma: Cmax in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: Cmax: Maximum concentration

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: tmax in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: tmax: Time of Cmax

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameter of gabapentin in plasma: AUC24h in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: AUC24h: Area under the concentration-time curve from the time of dosing to 24hours after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameter of gabapentin in plasma: Cmax in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: Cmax: Maximum concentration

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: tmax in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: tmax: Time of Cmax

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameter of gabapentin in plasma: AUC24h in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: AUC24h: Area under the concentration-time curve from the time of dosing to 24hours after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: AUClast in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: AUClast: Area under the concentration-time curve from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameter of gabapentin in plasma: AUCinf in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: AUCinf: Area under the concentration-time curve from the time of dosing extrapolated to time infinity

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: kel in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: kel: Elimination rate constant

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: t1/2 in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: t1/2: Terminal elimination half-life

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: CL/F in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: CL/F: Apparent total systemic clearance

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: Vz/F in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: Vz/F: Apparent volume of distribution during the terminal elimination phase

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: MRTinf in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: MRTinf: Mean residence time from the time of dosing extrapolated to time infinity

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: t1/2, pre in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: t1/2, pre: Elimination half-life for pre-hemodialysis

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: t1/2, HD in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: t1/2,HD: Elimination half-life for hemodialysis

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: t1/2, post in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: t1/2, post: Elimination half-life for post-hemodialysis

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin: CLDP in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: CLDP: Hemodialysis clearance calculated from the concentration of gabapentin at pre-dialyzer and post-dialyzer

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in plasma: AUCD in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: AUCD: Area under the concentration-time curve from the start to end of haemodialysis the concentration of gabapentin in plasma pre-dialyzer

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in urine: Ae72h in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: Ae72h: Amount of gabapentin excreted into the urine from the time of dosing to 72 hr after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in urine: Ae%72h in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: Ae%72h: Percent of gabapentin excreted into the urine from the time of dosing to 72 hr after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in urine: CLR in Renal impairment patients
primary_outcome.description: CLR: Renal clearance

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in urine: Ae48h in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: Ae48h: Amount of gabapentin excreted into the urine from the time of dosing to 48 hr after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in urine: Ae%48h in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: Ae%48h: Percent of gabapentin excreted into the urine from the time of dosing to 48 hr after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in dialyzing fluid: Adt in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: Adt: Cumulative amount in dialyzing fluid from the time of dosing to time after dosing

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in dialyzing fluid: Adt% in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: Adt%: Excretion rate in dialyzing fluid

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of gabapentin in dialyzing fluid: CLDD in Haemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.description: CLDD: Hemodialysis clearance calculated from the Cumulative amount in dialyzing fluid

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after the study drug dosing
primary_outcome.description: AEs: Adverse Events

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by Vital signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after the study drug dosing
primary_outcome.description: Supine blood pressure, supine pulse rate and axillary body temperature

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by Laboratory tests
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after the study drug dosing
primary_outcome.description: Hematology, blood biochemistry, and urinalysis

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by 12-lead ECGs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after the study drug dosing
primary_outcome.description: ECG: Electrocardiogram

clinical_study.condition: Patients With Impaired Renal Function and Haemodialysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body weight: ≥40.0 kg and <80.0 kg
- Body mass index BMI: ≥16.0 and <30.0 [BMI= Body weight (kg)/(Height (m))2]
- For Renal impairment patients: Patients with eGFR by GFR predictive equation for Japanese within < 50 mL.min/1.73m2 at screening and who is not undergoing dialysis
- For Haemodialysis patients: Patients who receive dialysis at screening
- Patients whose treatment regimen (including diet) for renal impairment or complications remain unchanged within 14 days prior to dosing, or patients who receive treatments (including diet) that need not to be changed during the period from 14 days before dosing to follow-up examination in the opinion of the investigator or sub-investigator.
- Female subjects who agree use effective contraception starting at informed consent and throughout the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a complication or history of the inappropriate for this study (except for a complication of primary disease for renal dysfunction, like diabetes etc., or complication of hypertension or anemia etc.)
- Patients with a complication or history of recurring alimentary disease
- Patients with a history of gastrointestinal surgical operation
- Patients with a complication of severe heart disease
- Patients with a complication or history of malignant tumor (However, a patient without recurrence of the malignant tumor for more than 5 years after the treatment may be eligible for the study.)
- Patients judged ineligible by the investigator or sub-investigator based on the results of medical examination, vital sign, 12-ECG and laboratory test
- Patients who have an Hb value <9g/dL at screening
- Patients who received or are scheduled to receive any study drugs in other clinical trials or post-marketing studies within 120 days before screening
- Patients who received or are scheduled to receive medications within seven days before the dosing of the investigational drug
- Patients who previously received administration of Gabapentin or ASP8825

link.description: Link to results on Astellas Clinical Study Results Web site
